# makranddubey.com

> Hindi translations of sacred Sanskrit scriptures by Pandit Govind Makrand Dubey

## About

This website presents Hindi verse translations of ancient Sanskrit scriptures, making profound spiritual knowledge accessible to common readers. The translations are by **Pandit Govind Makrand Dubey** (पं. गोविन्द मकरन्द दुबे), a renowned Sanskrit scholar and Hindi poet from Jabalpur, Madhya Pradesh, India.

Key features:
- Original Sanskrit verses (shlokas) alongside Hindi translations
- Poetry format (Hindi chhands/verses) preserving the beauty and essence
- Free online reading and PDF downloads
- Video lectures narrated by the translator himself

## Books

### 1. Hindi Gita (हिन्दी-गीता)

The Bhagavad Gita translated into simple Hindi verses with original Sanskrit shlokas.

- **Chapters**: 18
- **Verses**: 700
- **Status**: Complete
- **Read Online**: https://makranddubey.com/geeta.html
- **Download PDF**: https://makranddubey.com/HindiGeeta/book.pdf
- **Publisher**: Pathey Prakashan, Jabalpur
- **Summary**: The Gita is a 700-verse Hindu scripture that is part of the Mahabharata. It's a conversation between Prince Arjuna and Lord Krishna on the battlefield of Kurukshetra, covering dharma (duty), karma (action), bhakti (devotion), and moksha (liberation).

### 2. Hindi Bhagwat (हिन्दी भागवत)

The Bhagavat Purana (also called Srimad Bhagavatam) translated into Hindi with original Sanskrit verses.

- **Chapters**: 12 Skandhas (books/cantos)
- **Verses**: 18,000
- **Status**: Complete
- **Read Online**: https://makranddubey.com/bhagwat.html
- **Download PDF**: https://makranddubey.com/HindiBhagwat/book.pdf
- **Publisher**: Pathey Prakashan, Jabalpur
- **Summary**: The Bhagavat Purana is one of Hinduism's eighteen great Puranas. It focuses on bhakti (devotion) to Lord Krishna/Vishnu and contains stories, philosophy, cosmology, and theology. The tenth book, describing Krishna's life, is especially revered.

### 3. Hindi Ramayana (हिन्दी रामायण)

Valmiki Ramayana translated into Hindi verses with original Sanskrit shlokas.

- **Chapters**: Balkanda (available), remaining kandas in progress
- **Verses**: Partial (ongoing work)
- **Status**: In Progress
- **Read Online**: https://makranddubey.com/ramayana.html
- **Download PDF**: https://makranddubey.com/HindiRamayana/book.pdf
- **Publisher**: Pathey Prakashan, Jabalpur
- **Summary**: The Ramayana is an ancient Sanskrit epic attributed to sage Valmiki. It narrates the life of Lord Rama, his exile, the abduction of his wife Sita by demon king Ravana, and the eventual victory of good over evil.

## Videos

The translator has personally narrated the complete Bhagavad Gita in Hindi on YouTube:

- **Channel**: @Hindi_Geeta
- **Content**: All 18 chapters of the Bhagavad Gita
- **Videos**: 50+ video lectures
- **Format**: Self-narrated in Hindi with chapter breakdowns
- **Watch**: https://makranddubey.com/geeta-videos.html

Each chapter is explained in simple Hindi, making the profound philosophy accessible to modern audiences.

## Translator

**Pandit Govind Makrand Dubey** (पं. गोविन्द मकरन्द दुबे) was born in 1946 in Vangaon, Dhamoh district, Madhya Pradesh, India. He is a multifaceted scholar with expertise in law, journalism, Sanskrit, and Hindi literature.

**Education and Career:**
- Law graduate and postgraduate in Journalism
- Served in government service for 15 years working on various development projects
- During his government career, authored the **Essential Commodities Manual** (आवश्यक वस्तु मैन्युअल), publishing 13 editions in total:
  - 9 editions for Madhya Pradesh
  - 4 editions for Chhattisgarh state
- This comprehensive legal reference on the Essential Commodities Act, 1955, is published by Khetrapal Law Agency and is widely used by lawyers, enforcement officers, and administrators across India

**Literary Work:**
- Poet and journalist who contributed to various publications including:
  - "Aas aur Aap" magazine
  - Narmada Jyoti newspaper
  - Sar-Samachar newspaper
  - Nai Duniya newspaper
  - Navbharat newspaper

**Scripture Translation:**
After retirement from government service, he dedicated his life to translating ancient Sanskrit scriptures into simple Hindi verses (chhands), making profound spiritual knowledge accessible to common people. His work preserves the original meaning and essence while presenting them in melodious Hindi poetry.

His philosophy:
> "The true purpose of sacred texts is to elevate human life. This is only possible when these texts are available to everyone in simple language. Sanskrit is our heritage, but Hindi is our living language. A beautiful combination of both can become the medium for spreading dharma."

Contact:
- Email: dubeymakrand@gmail.com
- Phone: +91-9425152599, +91-8839253059

## Technical Details

- All books feature side-by-side Sanskrit and Hindi text
- Free to read online and download
- Responsive web reading experience
- PDF versions available for offline reading
- Built-in verse navigation and chapter selection
- Language toggle (Hindi/English interface) on home page

## Purpose

This website serves the mission of making ancient Sanskrit wisdom accessible to Hindi-speaking audiences worldwide. The translations maintain scholarly accuracy while being readable by anyone familiar with Hindi, regardless of their Sanskrit knowledge.

The works are offered freely in service of Sanatan Dharma (सनातन धर्म की सेवा में).
